column1: #Text=I was neither fooled or surprised, and in fact had been posting on these boards that just such a surplus would be announced for months now.
#Text=That doesn't change the fact that we're moving in the right direction.

#Text=A small surplus vs. a small deficit might be rather inconsequential from an economic perspective right now, but a small deficit today will turn into a BIG deficit in the not-too-distant future when the global economy weakens again.
#Text=Going by historic economic cycles right now the world is near the peak of the current cycle, despite what some politicians might try to convince you of.
#Text=That means that right now is the time to be paying down some nominal debt.
#Text=The 'good times', such as they are, aren't going to last.
#Text=Globally the economy is likely to weaken again in probably about 2 or 3 years time.
#Text=When that happens deficits will become inevitable, but at least if we've been paying down some debt we'll be in good shape to weather the storm.
